intro: Spiesia albiflora, commonly known as the whiteflower spurge, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and small, white flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many other spurge species. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky soils. Spiesia albiflora is adapted to withstand drought conditions due to its water-storing tissues.
